item.description:
Mohammed Molas, who studied film at the outstanding Russian film center VGIK, directed this 1983 film that "put Syrian cinema on the map".

Set during the turbulant 1950's, a mother is forced to move to Damascus with her two sons after the death of her husband. The city is at first a place of wonder for the children, but their innocence can not last.

Below is a link to a review.

After the movie I'll be standing near the front row holding a "Meet Up" sign. Then we'll walk down Hunington Ave where there a few nice places to eat and discuss.

For more information, see http://www.aff.org/ar...
item.name: Dreams of the City: a movie from Syria
